alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Durham; Granville; Lee; Orange; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 5:46PM EST until January 09 at 6:15PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN ORANGE...SOUTHWESTERN GRANVILLE...NORTHEASTERN LEE...WESTERN WAKE...DURHAM AND EASTERN CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 545 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Butner to near Cary to near Fuquay-Varina, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Chapel Hill, Creedmoor, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Butner, RDU International, and Apex. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for central North Carolina. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.

area.areaDesc: Chatham; Durham; Granville; Lee; Orange; Wake
